elements.content: Crystalline and permanently porous porphyrin-based metal tetraphosphonates† Timo Rhauderwiek Konrad Wolkersdörfer Sigurd Øien-Ødegaard Karl-Petter Lillerud Michael Wark and Norbert Stock 12,323,456,78,98,1091112,1314,1512,13,1613,16,1714,1518–2122,2324,2526,27Scheme of the high-throughput investigation of M-CAU-29 (M = Mn, Co, Ni, Mn) using Ni-H8TPPP (left) and MCl2 salts in H2O as solvent.282930,3132303230Crystal structure of Ni-CAU-29: (a) inorganic building unit (IBU), formed by two edge sharing NiO6 polyhedra, and next coordination environment, (b) stick-and-ball model showing the interconnection of the IBUs and the formation of 1D pores (2.8 × 5.0 Å and 3.8 × 3.8 Å) with PO3C and NiO6 polyhedra shown in purple and green, respectively, and (c) Connolly surface of the pores (green, probe radius of 1.8 Å, view along [101]).

Scheme of the high-throughput investigation of M-CAU-29 (M = Mn, Co, Ni, Mn) using Ni-H8TPPP (left) and MCl2 salts in H2O as solvent.

30

Crystal structure of Ni-CAU-29: (a) inorganic building unit (IBU), formed by two edge sharing NiO6 polyhedra, and next coordination environment, (b) stick-and-ball model showing the interconnection of the IBUs and the formation of 1D pores (2.8 × 5.0 Å and 3.8 × 3.8 Å) with PO3C and NiO6 polyhedra shown in purple and green, respectively, and (c) Connolly surface of the pores (green, probe radius of 1.8 Å, view along [101]).

elements.content: ‡ Crystal data. C45.50H24N4Ni2O14P4, M = 1091.95 g mol−1, triclinic, a = 9.561(5) Å, b = 15.086(9) Å, c = 16.722(9) Å and α = 94.723(9)°, β = 97.602(9)°, γ = 97.880(9)°, V = 2356(2) Å3, T = 100 K, space group P (no. 2), Z = 2, 6040 reflections measured, 1832 unique (Rint = 0.118), 1180 observed (I > 2σ(I)). The final R1 was 9.97% and the wR2 23.46% (I > 2σ(I)). CCDC 1566851 contains the crystallographic data for the structural analysis.
elements.clean_text: ‡ Crystal data. The final R1 was 9.97% and the wR2 23.46% (I > 2σ(I)). CCDC 1566851 contains the crystallographic data for the structural analysis.
